What is your overall assessment of this course?

I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Thorough understanding of the material history of photographylearning to think about it through the scientific lenses of chemistry, physics, and ecology. How to think about and analyze a photo beyond its visual components and how visuals and materiality combine to form greater meaning. How to work through Yale's archives and special collections.

I gained a whole new perspective on photography. This class deepened my appreciation not only for the art itself, but the process behind making the art. I had previously rarely thought about materiality, especially in photography, but now its all that I think about.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: This course was absolutely brilliant, completely changed the way I think about photography and its temporality and ethics. Professor Raab and Paul Messier complemented each other's knowledge and skills perfectly, which is often not the case for multi-instructor courses. Class visits were fantastic. Syllabus set up super well. Barely any uninteresting readings.

Strengths: professors were amazing and worked so well together. Really couldn't love them more and don't think they possibly could have done a better job.
Weaknesses: sometimes I felt that writing assignments were not that clear.
This class was amazing. Perhaps we could have spent more time talking about specific artists and their works and maybe even more time making our own photography.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would absolutely recommend this course. If you are deciding between this course and another, take this one. It's one of the best courses I've taken at Yale. It's not just about photography!!!! The way that we think about photography is the way that we think about the world around us.
YES. 100% take it if you can
Yes yes yes yes yes. I cannot recommend it more. Prof Raab is incredible and Prof Messier is equally great.
